intro: Picris dahurica, commonly known as common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flower heads consist of numerous tiny florets, with ray florets that are often sterile. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
